pr_title: Support missingColumnsOnInsert in the Phoenix Connector.

timeline.bodyText: Can we move all the SQL Keywords to Upper case
timeline.author: Praveen2112

timeline.bodyText: Can we add a non-null check here
timeline.author: Praveen2112
Praveen2112

timeline.bodyText:
Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
                            .filter(column -> ROWKEY.equalsIgnoreCase(column.getColumnName()))
          
          
            
                            .map(JdbcColumnHandle::getColumnName)
          
          
            
                            .map(JdbcColumnHandle::getColumnName)
          
          
            
                            .filter(ROWKEY::equalsIgnoreCase)
          
      
    
    
  

What if we could switch two lines, would it be better ?
timeline.author: Praveen2112

replies.bodyText: Yep. Much nicer. (A bit embarrassing that I missed that)
replies.author: lhofhansl

timeline.message:
Support missingColumnsOnInsert in the Phoenix Connector.

This is needed to provide the expected Phoenix INSERT semantics,
specifically when inserting using an existing row key.
Without this previous values of columns not specified in the INSERT list
would be incorrectly overwritten with NULL.
